course_title: Freshman Seminar:Anthropology: Animals Through the Ages
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)


This course examines the human-animal relationship from ancient through contemporary times by asking how animals and humans impact each other's lives and how understanding animals enriches human awareness of our place in the natural world. Examples of topics include representations of animals in art, religion and myth, pets and companionship, menageries and collecting, consumption, conservation, and animals in sport and entertainment.
course_description: Seminar on various anthropological topics. Satisfies general education Freshman Seminar.
schedule_location: TTh 10am-11:15am in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E101
